text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Haza was born in Nishinomiya on March 16, 1996. After graduating from Nippon Sport Science University, she joined her local club INAC Kobe Leonessa in 2018.INAC Kobe Leonessa She played 10 matches for the club. In August 2019, she moved to Spanish club AEM Lleida.INAC Kobe Leonessa On September 13, 2014, when Haza was 18 years old, she debuted for the Japan national team against Ghana. She was a member of Japan for 2014 Asian Games. She played 3 games and Japan won the 2nd place. She played 4 games for Japan in 2014. In November 2016, she was selected for the Japan U-20 national team for the 2016 U-20 World Cup and Japan won the 3rd place. ==Statistics== List of match in 2014 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2014 4 0 Total 4 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Hy≈çgo Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:INAC Kobe Leonessa players Category:Footballers at the 2014 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 2014 Asian Games
title: Hisui Haza
